subject: Re: [junit] JDK 1.5 annotations a la nUnit
msgSnippet: I d think clarity and readability would be advantages.  The same general arguments for meta-data rather than naming conventions would seem to apply. I haven t
messageBody:
I'd think clarity and readability would be advantages. The same
general arguments for meta-data rather than naming conventions would
seem to apply.

I haven't used annotations (meta-data) yet in Java 1.5, but this seems
simple enough to do. It could even do both: if meta-data is found,
that information is used, otherwise it attempts to match naming
conventions.

-Kevin Klinemeier


On Wed, 26 Jan 2005 20:42:57 +0100, Michael Schuerig
<michael@...> wrote:
>
> On Wednesday 26 January 2005 03:46, ezra_epstein wrote:
> > I did some work with .NET a while back. The nUnit port was pretty
> > cool: annotations, rather than naming conventions, are used to
> > indicate test methods.
> >
> > I'm wondering, now that annotations have been added to Java, is
> > anyone working on reverse-porting nUnit? If so, I'm interested in
> > helping. If not, anyone else interested in this?
>
> I'm wondering, what is the advantage?
>
> Michael
